children.subject: OP here, basically the same happened to me. I'm now waiting for them to process this new form, and I'm not getting any notification that it's being worked on.

Today I got an email back fives days after opening a ticket with SIS. They told me the CS70 discussion I asked to enroll in was full and that this was the reason the time conflict form didn't go through. Then I got an email saying my ticket had been resolved. I sure you can all imagine how frustrated this made me. The discussion section was wide open when I attempted to enroll. It became full a week later while I was waiting for SIS to help me. I immediately switched to an open section and filled out the time conflict form again. Not only did I already know what SIS sent me, but its not even an answer. This really destroyed what little faith I had left in the system. We all need a miracle for this to be worked out before phase II ends and we lose our guaranteed seats.

history.content: OP here, after the CS70 midterm was removed from the schedule, I made sure the discussion section for CS70 was open (not waitlist), that it didn't intersect with any other classes (so that there was only 1 possible conflict left), then submitted another override request and they added me to the class.
OP here, after the CS70 midterm was removed from the schedule, I made sure the discussion section for CS70 was open (not waitlist), submitted another override request and they added me to the class.

I'm just worried these problems won't be solved before the beginning of the semester. I understand that they are currently flooded with requests, but what if some of the conflicts are not resolved?

I'm sure others are quite worried as well, since the semester is rapidly approaching.

EDIT: the class in question is CS70, it seems that anyone having a conflict with CS70 is not getting their conflict processed.

Also, this is worrying me as well: 

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

"As soon as all undergraduate students have had their Phase II appointment, no seats will continue to be held for students with particular majors. Similarly, juniors and senior L&S students will also be able to be admitted to these classes at this time. Since now the waitlist will be processed in order, students with other majors and L&S juniors and seniors who used Phase I and Phase II to prioritize these classes will be enrolled before EECS and undeclared L&S students who wait until open enrollment to sign up for these classes."

I'm an EECS student, and the way things are going it doesn't seem I will be added to the class anytime soon, probably not before Phase II ends. Right now there are still seats reserved for EECS and intended CS students, but if the conflict doesn't get processed soon I am afraid I won't be able to join the class at all as the people on the waitlist will then get priority. This is extremely worrying.
history.subject: [RESOLVED] Another Post About Conflicts
